poem:
Title: In Flight

Afloat in the sky, 
is Qantas and Hudson,
Trading their dollars for tranquility.
"Bundle of rights," they've said, 
no seat or service pledged,
Yet, Justice too flies, in our economy.

$100m guilt, today in flight, 
$20m soft landing, welcomed sight,
Seasoned with a CEO's stride.
In this spectacle of deals and flights,
We remember, every customer's right.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Vanessa Hudson has provided a soft landing for Qantas as the airline cuts deal with ACCC In agreeing to pay a $100m penalty and compensate tens of thousands of customers to the tune of $20m for selling them tickets on already-cancelled flights, Qantas has abandoned its farcical claim that as an airline it doesn’t sell seats on a specific service, but rather a “bundle of rights”. For new CEO Vanessa Hudson – who stepped into". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
